bibl.title: Notes on the Yellow Fever Notebook, [1941?]

div1.p: Notes by an unknown author on the notebook found at the New York Academy of Medicine discuss references to the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Notes on the Yellow Fever Notebook, [1941?]
div1.p:
p. 37 --- “Mosquitoes caught in pts. room 20 Gen. Lee St. Quemados, May 23, 1900.”
Notes on six mosquitos follows.

p. 39. “Sherwood. Yellow fever. Pt. lived at 20 Gen. Lee St.” Case report follows.
Other case reports and autopsies follow.

pp. 82-5 ---- brief entries such as “8/6. Four mosq. bit Tamer at Los Animos. 3rd
day of illness. Temp. 101. 1. Examined 8/11 --- Neg.”
pp. 88-95 ---- “Blood examinations in yellow fever.” August 30, 1900 - Sept. 17, [1900].

pp. 105-43 ---- accounts of “Experimental yellow fever” cases from December 8, 1900, to
January 31, [1901]. These include Kissenger, Benigno, Fernandez, Precedo, Moran,
Martinez, Jernigen, etc.
pp. 170-97. “Malarial fevers.” These run from February 19, 1900 to August 17.

As the writing is not the same throughout the volume, it is possible that the Blood
examinations in yellow fever, pp. 88-95, ending Sept. 17, are in the hand of Lazear.
All of the names of the patients are given and there is no indication that he was
ever referring to himself.
